message:
Under MIT License - Interesting!

RT @amaboura: Atom is now open source! http://t.co/elv3LSZuzH
name: A hackable text editor for the 21st Century
caption: blog.atom.io
description: At GitHub, we’re building the text editor we’ve always wanted: hackable to the core, but approachable on the first day without ever touching a config file. We can’t wait to see what you build with it.

data.message: Other than it's from GitHub, why the hype around Atom?

The main idea is providing a Sublime  alternative that is updated regularly and responds to user feedback, which are the main 2 areas where Sublime fails. There's also the (arguable) idea that extending via JS is easier.

You can try the instructions for building on linux in the repository readme. You may get lucky. I know some guys tried the Windows one but got errors related to native node extensions,  but Linux is sure closer to Mac yhan Windows.
